headline: Simple Chicken Parmesan
description: This chicken Parmesan pasta is a fun recipe to make with kids that features boiled pasta, sautéed breaded chicken cutlets, and a simple tomato sauce.

video.description: A zesty Italian affair of chicken, sauce and cheese!
video.name: Simple Chicken Parmesan

name: Simple Chicken Parmesan
recipeIngredient: 2 medium garlic cloves, peeled and crushed
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
2 large boneless, skinless chicken breasts (6 to 8 ounces each), halved crosswise
freshly ground black pepper to taste
0.25 cup grated Parmesan cheese, plus more for serving

recipeInstructions.text: Make tomato sauce: Heat oil and garlic in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until garlic starts to sizzle. Stir in tomatoes, basil, oregano, and sugar; season with salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer; cook until sauce slightly thickens and flavors meld, 10 to 12 minutes. Cover and keep warm. (Remember, this makes twice the amount of sauce needed, so put aside half for another meal.)
Cook pasta: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti in boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 12 minutes. Drain and keep warm.
Make chicken cutlets: Lay chicken pieces between 2 sheets of plastic wrap. Use a mallet or heavy pan to pound chicken to about 1/4-inch thickness.
Beat egg in a shallow dish until well blended. Season bread crumbs with black pepper in another shallow dish.
Preheat the oven broiler to high. Place a rack 4 to 5 inches from the heat source.
Working with one cutlet at a time, dip chicken in beaten egg, then in bread crumbs. Lay breaded cutlets on a wire rack set over a cookie sheet (this step helps breading stay put).
Heat 1/4 cup oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat until it shimmers.
Fry breaded cutlets in hot oil until golden brown on each side, about 5 minutes total. Wash and dry the wire rack and return to the cookie sheet. Place fried cutlets on the clean wire rack.
Top each cutlet with mozzarella and Parmesan cheese. Broil until cheese melts and is spotty brown, 2 to 3 minutes.
Portion pasta onto 4 plates and top each with a chicken cutlet. Spoon 2 to 3 tablespoons tomato sauce over each cutlet, then sauce pasta as desired. Serve with extra Parmesan at the table.

review.reviewBody: Devious. Definitely going to make thos again. It was a big hit with the family.
I have 3 very picky eaters, and this was a hit. Delicious and simple.
It was excellent. I did use a hand blender to puree the sauce before serving just to appease my boys who don't like chunks of tomatoes.
Simple and tastes great. Everyone loved it.
very good would not change anything.
The family loved it!!! It took a little over 45 minutes to make. Would definitely make it again!!
Loved it. Easy & perfect for my 2yr old to enjoy.
Delicious and fun to make! I enjoyed learning to prepare this fairly easy, basic version of a classic dish.

Great basic chicken parm recipe! My only suggestion: use San Marzano tomatoes and eliminate the sugar - they are sweet enough as they are. Imported from Italy and easy to find in most groceries. I use Cento brand.

This really was super simple! I've never made chicken parmesan before outside of having it at a restaurant and was very surprised at how good this was.
I was missing dried basil however so I used some Italian Seasoning for the tomato sauce which worked great!
This was great and made my kids think I could cook!
It was easy and delicious .!

I pretty much followed the recipe, I used fresh, frozen tomatoes instead of canned, but the spices really gave the sauce a great flavor. I used chicken thighs because that's what I had available, the next time I will try it with chicken breast. Overall a very good Chicken Parmesan dish. There was extra sauce, which we used for spaghetti.
Turned out Excellent will make again and again

The preparation method for the chicken has been a game-changer for us! I use store-bought sauce, but really like the way the chicken is pan-fried then broiled with cheeses - it keeps it the exact right combo of juicy on the inside and crispy on the outside. I use garlic herb bread crumbs, otherwise the bread crumb coating is a little bland. Thanks for a regular addition to our rotation!
Really easy and really good. Will make many more times.
Husband and kinds Loved Loved this recipe.
Will definitely make it again
First time making it. It was a little tough to get the breadcrumbs to stick but maybe that’s because I didn’t use flour. Will try flour next time. Family loved it tho!

It was ok. Very labor intensive! My clean up crew (my husband) asked that I refrain from using the wire rack, especially in the oven on Broil. Using the rack twice contributed to a lot of clean up. I added the crushed garlic to both the sauce and the olive oil sauté of the chicken. Can’t have enough garlic! I used Marinara for the sauce and added the recommended spices. I believe baking the chicken instead of sautéing in a pan and broiling would produce a better result. That said, I tried it and learned a lot! Thank you.
I made it as written as I had never made chicken Parmesan before. My husband loves chicken Parmesan. He loved this!

I added 2 more cloves of garlic being as my wife and i like it and i did not use basil because i didnt have any on hand. It turned out real well especially being that i normally cant cook if it is not on the grill
Next time I would cook the chicken in slightly less oil. The breading on the chicken turned out a little soggy, but the flavor was great!
Delicious meal, and easy to prepare. Will make again

I cut the recipe in half, except for the sauce, since I was only making it for me. It turned out well, but not perfect. I love the taste of the marinara sauce, but it's very watery. I plan to add tomato paste to it while keeping the same flavor. I also want to make it without the breading, to cut the carbs, because I'm diabetic.

I followed this recipe (almost) to the letter, unusual for me. About the only changes I made were that I added a pinch of red pepper flakes to the marinara sauce to give it a little heat, and I left out the sugar because I don't like extra sweetness in savory dishes, and the crushed tomatoes I used were sweet enough on their own. Since I'm a beginning/intermediate cook, I particularly liked the little hints such as putting the breaded chicken cutlets on a rack to help the bread crumbs stay put. 
In any case my strictest critic (wife) said it was delicious, and that's all that matters :). I'll definitely make it again.
I've posted a picture, which also includes a "zoodle" (zucchini noodle) warm salad that I got from another source.
This was delicious
made this for my superbowl crowd with my own marinara sauce and everyone loved it
Excellent. Every one enjoy, very tasty
This was sooooo delicious. Of course I seasoned my meat with extra seasoning, and let refrigerate for at least 7 hours then i cooked my meat. The chicken breast was sooo juicy and tender.
My 6yo daughter LOVED this and demanded seconds. My husband and I enjoyed as well. Definitely on the dinner rotation!
I followed the recipe exactly. The only mistake I made was broiling the chicken for too long on high (5 min). Next time I will keep an eye on it. Really tasty.
I made it according to the recipe and I wasn't too happy with the results. I probably won't make it again for awhile.

This is the 2nd time making this. It is a new family favorite. The changes I made: Sautéed breaded chicken in butter and I made the sauce with hot sausage, garlic, and herbs from my garden. I served over zucchini zoodles. So very good.
This recipe was simple to follow. My family really enjoy it. It's now apart of my personal cook book.
Awesome
Quick easy and delicious!
Added Italian seasoning to the bread crumbs. I also used tomato sauce with diced tomatoes for the sauce. My husband LOVED this dish.
I made it and it was delicious my sister today was like Ian can you make your chicken parmigiana again it was so good lol

It was good but could have been better, especially with all of the steps involved. I would increase the amount of mozzarella cheese on the chicken and season the tomato sauce with more salt, garlic and onion powder, and double the basil.

Excellent recipe. Best I have tried for this dish. So often on AR the posted recipe is bare-bones and you have to read the reviews to get the technique. So I really appreciate the OP giving directions and timing. It's not complex. It's through. SO I followed the directions exactly- only change was seasoning the bread crumbs. It's really important to pound the chicken flat and let the breaded breasts rest on the rack for a few minutes. The breading actually stayed on during frying (for once) and cooked evenly. Don't mess w the chicken. Only turn it once. Line your baking sheet w foil. I placed the chicken directly from the frying pan into the clean rack- drained fine- then broiled as directed. Chicken came out juicy and nice and crispy- not at all soggy, which is my biggest complaint w chic parm. My whole family, including grandma and a picky 4 yr old, loved this. (Kids say it was "delicious"). My husband's only complaint was "babe, you didn't make enough chicken!" (LOL There IS a small amount of leftovers, but next time I will increase it so we get 2 full meals out of it. It was that good.) I served this w EZ Drop Biscuits from AR. Thanks for a "keeper"!!
just add flour to dredge

This meal came out great. The whole family was pleased! I did add extra seasonings to the sauce, such as onion powder, garlic powder, and Italian seasoning. I used Italian bread crumbs for extra flavor instead of plain with the chicken. It was sort of a messy meal to make, but I enjoyed making it. I have added this to my favorites and I will be making it again down the road.

A good, basic chicken parmesan recipe. I prefer to use Italian style bread crumbs, and add either some Parmigiano-Reggiano or Pecorino cheese to the bread crumbs, along with a bit of garlic powder, just to pump up the flavor a bit. It's true, though, that kids never complain when chicken parm is served - which is a huge plus in our home.

This was my first attempt at Chicken Parmesan. The note is right, there are a lot of steps but definitely some good flavor in this recipe. I think I needed to use thinner chicken breasts because it took a while to cook it thru and the coating was starting to get too dark. Will try this again with pre-butchered thin breasts. I actually use the tomato sauce recipe just as-is over pasta. I think it's delicious and it's super easy to make!
We filleted the chicken breasts rather than pounding them and that worked fine. Loved it, will make again!
So good my hubby loved it . The only change I made was I added Garlic powder and onion powder . Also I used Italian bread crumbs. It came out juicy and full of flavor??
sauce its amazingly good and the dish is pretty simple to make. i did it exactly as it said just added some white wine to the sauce and a pinch of nutmeg and it was awsome

This was fabulous. I only had sauce on-hand, which was perfectly fine, and ended up eyeballing the seasoning, as the recipe goes a little light in that regard. My husband and I have been traumatized by a bad chicken parm recipe to the point we haven't made it in a number of years. I decided to go for it tonight and he absolutely raved over it, and I thought it was excellent myself. Miracle of miracles - our faith in a chicken Parmesan recipe has been restored!
This was good but definitely not simple. It actually seemed like you were looking to make this recipe more complicated than it should be. Just take the word "simple" out of the title and you're fine.
Felt like it lacked flavor. I think if you add seasoning to the chicken it might make it more flavorful. Just an opinion it looks great though!
Loved the chicken! Didn't have to change that one bit.. Had the sauce turned out the same it would be a 5 star recipe.

Great recipe and love how simple it is!!Hate to be one of those people who changes the recipe, however, I used Italian seasoned Panko crumbs on my chicken which gave it a nice crunch that regular bread crumbs can't do. Other than that, I followed the recipe and it was fabulous. My kids devoured it and were wondering where the leftovers were the next day....I told them there weren't any because they ate it all. :). Great recipe and so simple!!!
It was good! I left the chicken whole which might have been a mistake and I used too much olive oil for frying! I think I prefer an oven baked version of this recipe which I'm gonna try next time.
Other than using Rotini instead of spaghetti, I made this recipe as is. It was a lot easier than I thought it would be and so flavorful! Will never buy jar sauce again!

Food came out great, although I feel like the directions are a little confusing for those less experienced in the kitchen. FYI: Heat the oil on medium and wait til after you coat the chicken to do so if your not hot oil savvy. Just a small plug!
Made to exact recipe and turned out great! Was quick and easy to do on a week night.

Absolutely wonderful! This was my first time making chicken parm, and i am not that great in the kitchen (but im learning) and i completed this with ease! It was a little scary cooking the chicken with the oil spitting, however it all came out wonderfully. The sauce tasted amazing, as did the chicken. It has now been deemed a household favorite in my home :)
A very good recipe to start with. After using this recipe a couple of times I did make a few changes; Such as prepared spaghetti sauce and I will use any type of cheese that I have on hand.
We love this recipe. I filet the breasts so they are thin - we like them crispier. I also use jarred marinara and then spice it up myself.
Delicious. I also soaked my chicken breasts in buttermilk and spices overnight and used panko. Didn't bother with the noodles, the chicken is so filling on its own.
I use my own sauce, but the chicken for the chicken Parmesan is excellent!!!
I did the sauce differently but 5 stars for sure!!
I followed the recipe and it seemed like the chicken was a little undercooked, which makes me nervous.

This is a fairly easy recipe and has wonderful results. Make sure to absolutely use crushed tomatoes and not diced or anything else so that the marinara's consistentcy turns out well. Also, I dont use plain bread crumbs either; I use seasoned stuffing that I crushed up with a bowl and plate. Other than that, I made no changes and everyone loved it.

I am giving it a 5 star before I even try it...I am going to try this recipe tonight! I love panko crumbs because I like the crunch. I also have some frozen homemade hot italian sausage spaghetti sauce so I can't wait to try that on top!

This Parm was great! I pounded the chicken and breaded it in egg and bread crumbs, then pan fried and transferred to a wire rack over a cookie sheet, topped each with cheese and baked at 350 for about 15 minutes (only because the broil setting on my oven sets off my smoke detector!) I used jarred sauce because it's what was on hand.
I served it with spaghetti squash topped with the same store-bought sauce and more cheese.
My boyfriend raved, which is rare!
Easy enough to make on a weeknight.
Excellent recipe. The sauce was awesome and the chicken very moist and tender. Delicious! Hubby says it is a keeper. Will make it often.

Such an easy, but, great recipe!!!! My husband said "Now this is good eating," when he took a bite. The only thing I did different was used a bottle of the jarred sauce. I know it's prolly not 1/2 as great as homemade sauce but I was in a hurry and had a jar in the cabinet, lol.

Made this last night and it was simply delicious...only thing i did different was add parm. cheese and some herbs to the bread crumbs.The sauce was a perfect compliment to the chicken....we loved it! *tucking this recipe away in the recipe box*

This dish was delicious and easy. My family loved it. The only change Ii made was to add fresh herbs to the sauce as it was simmering and I also added some fresh herbs to the breadcrumbs. I will be making this dish often.
Have made this several times now, and each time the family loves it more and more. Easy and delicious.
Great recipe. Will definitely make again.

This Recipe was extremely easy to make. :) It smells fantastic as well. I had a moment of duh when it make to the water, I thought it was for the chicken to go in at first and I said to myself now why on earth would I do that.... lol I said skip it and then it dawned on me it was for the noodle hehe :D other than that great find!!!!!!!
Sauce had a metallic taste and was very thin. Sauce not very flavorful.
Very yummy my husband loves it this is his favorite dish!!
Very good...the whole family enjoyed this. Thank you!

This reciepe as written is over-complicated.. I skipped making pasta sauce and just bought a jar from the store. Cut one ckn breast in half and smashed the halves. Dipped in egg/bread crumbs twice, cooked in skillet for a bit, then topped with cheese and cooked under broiler for a couple mins. Turned out great, topped with the pasta sauce and parm. EZ mode!
This was excellent the first time that I made this. The second time, I added wheat germ and ground flax seed to the bread crumbs, and the flavor was even better! I highly recommend this recipe.

My family loved this! It was easy and delicious. My son is autistic and a very picky eater. He ate this dish without the sauce but loved the chicken. I also didn't have time to make the homemade sauce and bought store but. Will definetly make this meal again. Thanks!

This was awesome! I didn't know an exact time I could serve dinner due to our schedule so instead of broiling this, I put it in a baking dish, covered it with the sauce and baked it @ 300 degrees for an hour. When serving it I put thin spaghetti on the plate and put one breast with sauce on top. It was so tender and the flavors baked in. My family loved it!
Loved this recipe!! My husband loved it as well!
Delicious!

DELICIOUS! But I wouldn't call it "simple" at all! It's a long process, but it is definitely worth it! I added more salt to the sauce, but otherwise, I will certainly make this sauce - and probably the whole dish, when I have more time - again!

I thought this was great as did husband and two of the kids. The other two kids did not like it. We used jarred sauce for convenience. I followed the instructions otherwise except for: (1) marinated the chicken first in buttermilk (2) After sauteeing step, I skipped the wire rack step and just put it in a greased baking dish in a 450 oven for 5 minutes and (3) my way to get the chicken thin enough was to slice it when it was still partly frozen - it was very easy to slice 1/2" thick or less when still half frozen. I found that to be much easier than pounding it or than butterflying it when thawed.

Very good....who doesnt love chicken parm! Doubled the recipe and used red wine instead of the sugar for the sauce. Also used whole wheat seasoned crumbs to coat the chicken. Served with whole grain angle hair pasta and a ceasar salad. Yummy Sunday dinner. Thanks.

So good! Whole family loved it! The note says that it makes twice as much sauce as is needed, but I let it simmer while I did the chicken and it reduced and got thicker and was just enough. I doubled the oregano and basil and added a bit more sugar, as per our family's taste. Word to the wise: the breading on the chicken burns fairly easily at med-hi heat, so a medium heat would be better. I am already excited to make this again!

I am only reviewing the sauce, since I used another recipe for the parmesan chicken portion. This sauce is so simple, yet tastes so good! Followed the recipe except added 3x the amount of garlic, as I am a garlicoholic!!! Great simple dish for a weeknight! The family loved it! I will NEVER buy jarred sauce again, since this is so quick to make and I always have all ingredients on hand.
This is so good this is our second time this week making it. The entire family (7 of us) loves it... I never thought the chicken would be completely cooked in 5 minutes but it was. A new favorite!

I followed another reviewer's suggestion of marinating the chicken ahead of time in buttermilk (made with lowfat milk with vinegar). Followed the cooking instructions and the results were crispy on outside, moist inside. My kids loved this...
Exactly as it says...simple, easy and delish!
This recipe was excellent. The sauce was outstanding. I plan on using that sauce for other italian dishes.

For the sauce I added a 14.5 oz can of diced tomatoes and omitted the oregano. For the chicken I coated it in flour before the egg and used Panko for the bread crumbs. After the chicken fried I topped each with a 1/4 C of the sauce and 3 T of a mozzarella/provolone blend and a T of parmesan and baked it for about 8 minutes at 450 degrees.
This is delicious and easy. To make it even easier on myself, I buy ready made sauce. Just heat up on the stove, and pour it on the chicken and pasta.
Good recipe...looks tidious but its not! The sauce was perfecto...
This one is definitely a winner! I keep wondering...'where has this recipe been all my life?'

I've made this two times now. Once as is, and once with a few modifications. It was good as the recipe was written, but could definitely use a little oomph! Sauce: I added some red pepper flakes and doubled all the seasonings except for the sugar, then, i thickened it with a little roux. Breading: I used Panko bread crumbs, flour, parmesan, flour, basil leaves, oregano and a little pepper. The chicken is good enough to eat by itself!

Wow my family LOVED this recipe! When me and my mom find a recipe we all agree on (My mom, dad, brother, and I) we add it to the short list of a whole family pleasers, instead of me and my brother have chicken tenders and mom and dad having bean soup. This is going right onto the list! I cheated and used Creamy Vodka sauce (Its amazing, you gotta try it!). Everyone ate until they were stuffed. Next time i'll be using a new brand of bread crumbs... I didn't like them so much. Thanks for the AMAZING recipe :)!
